intro: Harpalyce crepidina, commonly known as the narrowleaf harpalyce, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, trifoliate leaves. The plant produces yellowish to reddish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Harpalyce crepidina is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It plays a role in stabilizing soils and provides forage for wildlife in its native range.
